intro: Spermacoce insularis, commonly known as the Island Spermacoce, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it is often found in moist, tropical environments. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and birds. Spermacoce insularis is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
